channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Weeds and tall grasses along curbs, side of pavements and bases of trees, 26th June
item.description:
The road has become very unkept on the last 2 months with lots of weeds being allowed to grow along curbs, on the inside of pavements and around the bases of the trees, it looks unkept, gathers litter and will eventually cause cracks in the pavements etc.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cotesbach Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hundreds of gallons of water being wasted, 26th June
item.description:
Today (26/06/25) at 10.15 am a Bexley road cleaning vehicle (MD24 CYU) was filling his tanker from the water hydrant in Edison Road. While his tanker was filling up with water the hosepipe connecting the hydrant to his tanker was leaking hundreds of gallons of water. I spoke to the driver and asked if he could do anything about the shameful water wastage and he said there was nothing he could do as the hosepipe had several splits and a poor seal at the hydrant connection. He said he had ordered a new hose a while ago but was still waiting for the replacement. The driver gave me the impression this was not an isolated incident, so how many thousands of gallons of water are being wasted daily during this extreme drought we are experiencing. I would suggest that this vehicle needs to be taken out of service until a new hose is made available. Perhaps checks need to be made on the rest of your road cleaning fleet.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wordsworth Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes blocking at Seymour Street next to hyatt hotel, 26th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-9, Seymour Street, Marylebone, London

item.title: Historic street lamp requires restoration/painting., 26th June
item.description:
It is in a very poor state of repair and unsightly in a conservation area and is detrimental to the street scene. This post has clearly not been maintained for many years.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Durham Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Follow up to my report 7763888 dated 25/6, 26th June
item.description:
I refer to my report 7763888 from yesterday. The rubbish dumped in Melvin Road against the side fence of 78 Croydon Road is on the public highway as shown in the photo.The rubbish is bags of old shoes and not really a public health issue or maybe they are ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melvin Road, Anerley, London
